str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
Agrippa, i.e. Herod Agrippa II. Apparently from agrios and hippos; wild-horse tamer; Agrippas, one of the Herods.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To say, declare. Properly, the same as the base of phos and phaino; to show or make known one's thoughts, i.e. Speak or say.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Festus. Of Latin derivation; festal; Phestus, a Roman.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I am powerful, have (the) power, (b) I am able, I can. Of uncertain affinity; to be able or possible.

parse: Verb - Perfect Infinitive Middle or Passive
str2: From apo and luo; to free fully, i.e. relieve, release, dismiss, or let die, pardon or divorce.
If. A primary particle of conditionality; if, whether, that, etc.

parse: Verb - Pluperfect Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) To call (name) by a supplementary (additional, alternative) name, (b) mid: To call upon, appeal to, address.
Of Latin origin; Caesar, a title of the Roman emperor.
